intro: Anoplophytum vittatum, commonly known as the spotted spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with milky sap. Anoplophytum vittatum is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
